alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 5:44AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...GUSTY NORTHEASTERLY WINDS WITH AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... Gusty northeasterly winds will continue across the Matanuska Valley through Monday evening, with the strongest winds expected Monday morning. During this time, expect sustained winds of 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph. These winds will persist through Monday morning before slowly diminishing through Monday afternoon and evening. Areas of blowing and drifting snow are likely with the strongest winds; however, significant reductions to visibility are not expected. Please continue to take precautions to protect property. Expect challenging driving conditions in areas of strong winds and blowing and drifting snow. For the latest forecast visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
